Generate a simulated data of size $n = 100$ from the regression $$y_i = 10 + 5x_i + \epsilon_i, ~~ \epsilon_i \stackrel{iid}{\sim} N(0, 2)$$ using the code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x <- runif(100) y <- 10 + 5 * x + rnorm(100, sd = sqrt(2)) ``` ::: Fit a simple linear regression model to the data, then check whether the true slope is captured by the 90% confidence interval for the slope. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm_out <- lm(y ~ x) confint(lm_out, level = 0.9) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 5 % 95 % (Intercept) 9.347448 10.303577 x 4.454147 6.015095 ``` ::: :::
